mim.author: Sivakumar Ganoz
mim.name: AxeInfrastructureTransportM
mim.description: AXE Infrastructure Transport Management function MOM.

struct.name: Ipv4SubnetVlan
struct.description: IPV4 subnet for the VLAN ID classification. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - Invalid VLAN ID reference: Specified VLAN ID does not match any existing VLAN on the Bridge. - Unsupported Bridge for Subnet VLAN: Subnet VLAN is not supported on the selected Bridge. - Invalid IPv4 subnet: Specified value for ipv4Subnet attribute is not a valid IPv4 subnet. - Specified Ipv4Subnet is already used: Another Subnet VLAN with the same IPv4 subnet already exists on the same Bridge.

structMember.name: vlanId
structMember.description: Specifes the VLAN ID to be assigned to the classified frames.

structMember.name: ipv4Subnet
structMember.description: Specifies the IPv4 subnet for the VLAN ID classification. One subnet can be assigned more than one VLAN.

enum.name: VrrpSessionState
enum.description: VRRP state of the virtual router.

enumMember.name: INIT
enumMember.description: Indicates that the virtual router is waiting for a startup event.

enumMember.name: BACKUP
enumMember.description: Indicates that the virtual router is monitoring the availability of the master router.

enumMember.name: MASTER
enumMember.description: Indicates that virtual router is forwarding packets for IP addresses associated with this router.

enum.name: VrrpErrReason
enum.description: Possible reasons for encountered VRRP errors.

enum.name: BfdSessionOperState
enum.description: The operational states of a BFD session.

enumMember.name: PERMIT
enumMember.description: Allow the packet that matches the ACL to flow.

enumMember.name: DENY
enumMember.description: Drop the packet if it matches the ACL.

enumMember.name: FRAGMENT
enumMember.description: The entry matches all fragments. FO > 0 or MF != 0.

enumMember.name: INITIAL
enumMember.description: The entry matches complete (unfragmented) packets as well as initial fragments, FO==0.

enumMember.name: NONINITIAL
enumMember.description: The entry matches non-initial fragments. FO>0.

enum.name: VrrpvPrioSession
enum.description: Configure the type of this VRRP router.

enumMember.name: TRUE
enumMember.description: Vrrpv3 session with higher priority than the other session referencing the same Vrrpv3Interface MO.

enumMember.name: FALSE
enumMember.description: Vrrpv3 session with lower priority than the other session referencing the same Vrrpv3Interface MO.

enum.name: EthPortOperatingMode
enum.description: Operating modes specify speed, duplex and master/slave states.

derivedDataType.name: Ipv4AddressAndPrefixLengthStr
derivedDataType.description:
IPv4 address string, controlled by a regular expression. The address is specified in dotted-quad decimal notation in accordance with RFC791, without leading zeros.
The IPv4 address is within the range [0-126,128-223].[0-255].[0-255].[0-255], 7-15 characters. The prefix length is a number from 0 to 32.

derivedDataType.name: Ipv4UnicastAddressStr
derivedDataType.description:
IPv4 address string, controlled by a regular expression.
The address is specified in dotted-quad decimal notation in accordance with RFC791, without leading zeros.
IPv4 addresses are within the range [1-126,128-223].[0-255].[0-255].[0-255], 7-15 characters. Valid characters: 0123456789.
Example: 1.1.1.1, 1.1.255.255

derivedDataType.name: MacAddressStr
derivedDataType.description:
MAC address string, controlled by a regular expression.
Address should be specified in colon separated hexadecimal notation as described in IEEE 802. MAC addresses must have 17 characters. Valid characters: 0123456789abcdefABCDEF Regular expression: ([0-9A-Fa-f]{2}:){5}[0-9A-Fa-f]{2} Example: 00:12:34:56:78:9A

derivedDataType.name: VlanName
derivedDataType.description: Type of vlanName. The string must not contain whitespace and must be less than 32 characters long.

derivedDataType.name: IpDscpStrST
derivedDataType.description:
Smart type for IpDscp, covering a single value or a range. Regexp : ^((BT)|((BT)(\.\.)(BT)))$ where BT=[0-9]|[1-5][0-9]|6[0-3]
A DSCP value. Can be a single value [dd] or a range [dd..dd], where dd represents an integer in {0..63}.
Example: 1 or 5..10

derivedDataType.name: IcmpType
derivedDataType.description:
Regular expression pattern for IP ACL ICMP Type [0-255], covering single and range.
Regexp : ^((BT)|((BT)(\.\.)(BT)))$ where BT=[0-9]{1,2}|1[0-9]{2}|2[0-4][0-9]|25[0-5]

derivedDataType.name: IpProtocolNumberStrST
derivedDataType.description:
Regular expression pattern for IP protocol numbers [0-255], covering a single value or a range.
Regexp : ^((BT)|((BT)(\.\.)(BT)))$ where BT=[0-9]{1,2}|1[0-9]{2}|2[0-4][0-9]|25[0-5]
Example: 1 or 5..10

derivedDataType.name: L4PortStrST
derivedDataType.description:
Regular expression pattern type for transport protocol port [0-65535] inputs.
Covering list of values, ranges. Regexp=^((BT)|((BT)(\.\.)(BT)))$ where BT=[0-9]{1,4}|[1-5][0-9]{4}|6[0-4][0-9]{3}|65[0-4][0-9]{2}|655[0-2][0-9]|6553[0-5].

derivedDataType.name: Priority
derivedDataType.description:
Priority of a policy rule.
Priority values must be unique amongst policy rules under the same policy. Rule: valid values are 0 and positive integers. Note: 0 is the highest priority, larger values give lower priority.
Maximum possible range: 0..65535

derivedDataType.name: VirtualRouterId
derivedDataType.description:
Virtual Router Identifier. It must be in the format: <subrack>_<slot>:<VRname> where <subrack> and <slot> are the subrack address and the slot position of the physical router hosting the VR. <VRname> is a string identifying the VR, it must not contain white spaces or special characters.
E.g.: 1.0.0.0_0:VRInstance1

rule.exceptionText: Virtual Router Identifier must be in the format: "<subrack>_<slot>:<VRname>". VRname must not contain special character and must not exceed 12 characters in length.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

rule.exceptionText: AddressId must not contain special character and must not exceed 12 characters in length.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

rule.exceptionText: VrrpSessionId must not contain special character and must not exceed 12 characters in length.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

rule.exceptionText: DstId must not contain special character and must not exceed 12 characters in length.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

rule.exceptionText: NextHopId must not contain special character and must not exceed 12 characters in length.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

derivedDataType.name: AddressIPv4andPrefixLengthStr
derivedDataType.description:
IPv4 address string, controlled by a regular expression. The address is specified in dotted-quad decimal notation in accordance with RFC791, without leading zeros.
The IPv4 address is within the range [0-126,128-223].[0-255].[0-255].[0-255], 7-15 characters. The prefix length is a number from 0 to 31.

class.name: TransportM
class.description: Represents the root MOC for AXE Infrastructure Transport function MOM. It is automatically created in case APG cableless configuration with SMX or SCX shelf architecture. It allows the configuration of infrastructure L2 and L3 network connectivity. The L2 configuration includes: • Port configuration • VLAN configuration • Link aggregation configuration (LAGs) The L3 configuration can be further divided in 2 subparts: • basic settings: Routers, IPv4 interfaces, Static Routes. • advanced settings:Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD), Virtual Router Redundnacy Protocol (VRRP), Access Control List (ACL).

attribute.name: transportMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: Bridge
class.description: Represents an ethernet L2 forwarding technique. A network bridge connects multiple network segments at the data link layer (Layer 2) of the OSI model. In Ethernet networks, the term bridge formally means a device that behaves according to the IEEE 802.1D standards. Bridging takes place at OSI Model Layer 2 (data-link layer), that it (including MAC Bridge, Provider Bridge) directs frames according to hardware assigned MAC addresses.

attribute.name: bridgeId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: bridgeAddress
attribute.description: Specifies the MAC address of the Bridge.

attribute.name: numberOfPorts
attribute.description: Specifies the number of ports attached to the bridge.

attribute.name: numberOfVlans
attribute.description: Specifies the current number of VLANs defined on the bridge.

attribute.name: ipv4SubnetVlan
attribute.description: Represents an IPv4 subnet based VLAN. For an inbound untagged frame, if it has an IPv4 header and its source IPv4 address belongs to the IPv4 subnet of this entry, the VlanId of this entry must be used.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

class.name: BridgePort
class.description: Represents a port attaching to a bridge. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied.

attribute.name: bridgePortId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: operState
attribute.description: Specifies the current operative state of the port.

attribute.name: defaultVlanId
attribute.description: Specifies the default VLAN ID for the inbound untagged frames.

attribute.name: portAddress
attribute.description: Specifies the physical address of the port attached to the bridge.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

attribute.name: adminState
attribute.description: Specifies the intended state of the port.

class.name: Vlan
class.description: Represents a VLAN entity. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - System-protected object cannot be modified or deleted: The MO is system-protected and cannot be modified or deleted. - Cannot remove an object referenced by other object(s): The MO cannot be deleted since it is referenced by other MO(s), whose DN(s) are listed in reservedBy attribute. - Specified VLAN ID is already used: Another VLAN with the same VLAN ID already exists on the same Bridge. - Cannot modify VLAN ID: A previously assigned VLAN ID cannot be changed. - Cannot delete a VLAN used by a Subnet VLAN: Selected VLAN cannot be removed since it is used by a Subnet VLAN. - Invalid tagged BridgePort specified: One or more of tagged BridgePort(s) specified are not valid for this VLAN. - Invalid untagged BridgePort specified: One or more of untagged BridgePort(s) specified are not valid for this VLAN. - Specified BridgePort is member of an Aggregator: One or more of tagged/untagged BridgePort spcified are member of an Aggregator and cannot be individually set as member of a VLAN. - Same BridgePort cannot be set as both tagged and untagged member of a VLAN: One or more BridgePort are configured as both tagged and untagged in the same VLAN.

attribute.name: vlanId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. Specifies the name of the VLAN.

attribute.name: taggedBridgePorts
attribute.description: Specifies the set of tagged member BridgePorts for this VLAN. Frames belonging to this VLAN will be VLAN-tagged upon transmission through tagged BridgePort members.

attribute.name: untaggedBridgePorts
attribute.description: Specifies the set of un-tagged BridgePort members for this VLAN. Frames belonging to this VLAN will be un-tagged when transmitted through an un-tagged member BridgePort.

attribute.name: vid
attribute.description: Specifies The VLAN identifier. If this attribute has no value, it will be ignored. If it has a non-empty value, this value must be unique. For a Vlan being a child of a Bridge MO, uniqueness means that no other Vlan under the same Bridge can have the same ID.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

class.name: EthernetPort
class.description: Represents a physical entity that provides Ethernet-like MAC service access point. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - auto-negotiation configuration not allowed on this Ethernet port : the Ethernet port does not support auto-negotiation or it doesn't allow to ENABLE/DISABLE it.

attribute.name: ethernetPortId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: macAddress
attribute.description: Specifies the assigned MAC address.

attribute.name: maxFrameSize
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum size in byte that the layer can pass onwards. The recommended value range is from 64 to 9600.

attribute.name: operOperatingMode
attribute.description: Specifies the operational speed, duplex and master/slave state of the Ethernet port.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

attribute.name: autoNegotiateAdminState
attribute.description: Specifies the intended state of the auto-negotiation on the Ethernet port. If supported by the Ethernet port, the auto-negotiation allows to negotiate with a connected device the mode of operation: speed rate, duplex mode (half duplex or full duplex), and flow control. The transmission parameters that can be negotiated vary depending on the capabilities of the Ethernet port.

attribute.name: autoNegotiateOperState
attribute.description: Specifies the current operative state of the auto-negotiation on the Ethernet port.

attribute.name: aggregatorId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: adminAggMember
attribute.description: Specifies the link aggregation member or the candidate group of the aggregator. If static mode, this attribute represent link aggregation member that references to ethernet port. Nil value in this mode means no port member in this aggregator. If dynamic mode, for candidate approach, this attribute represents the candidate group of the aggregator, it references to ethernet port. Nil value in this mode means no candidate port for this dynamic aggregator.

attribute.name: dataRate
attribute.description: Specifies the current data rate of the link aggregation in M-bits per second. The value is calculated as N times the data rate of a single link in the aggregation, where N is the number of active links.

attribute.name: operState
attribute.description: Represents the operative state of the aggregator. It is ENABLED if at least one ethernet port in the group is operative.

attribute.name: operAggMember
attribute.description: Specifies the ethernet port that are actually being a member of the aggregator. Empty value in this attribute means no actual port is added in this aggregator.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

class.name: Router
class.description: Represents an IP routing domain instance. It provides data plane isolation of routed traffic and control plane isolation of routing entities from other routing instances. It allows for further fragmentation of the routing domain. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - System-protected object cannot be modified or deleted: The MO is system-protected and cannot be modified or deleted.

attribute.name: routerId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

class.name: BfdSessionIPv4
class.description: Represents an IPv4 BFD Session Information.

attribute.name: bfdSessionIPv4Id
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: detectionTime
attribute.description: Specifies the detection time of the local endpoint. It is the period of time lapsed without receiving BFD packets, after which the local endpoint will declare the session down. RFC 5880 specifies that the Detection Time calculated in the local endpoint is equal to the value of the detection multiplier received from the remote endpoint, multiplied by the agreed transmit interval of the remote system. If the remote endpoint has a shorter detection time value, this will be the effective detection time for the session.

attribute.name: intervalTxNegotiated
attribute.description: Specifies the negotiated interval at which the local node transmits BFD control packets.

attribute.name: localDiscriminator
attribute.description: Specifies the local discriminator for this BFD session used for unique identification.

attribute.name: addrDst
attribute.description: Specifies the remote IP address of the BFD session.

attribute.name: portSrc
attribute.description: Specifes the source UDP port for BFD session control packets. RFC5881 specifies the value to be within the range of 49152 through 65535.

attribute.name: sessionState
attribute.description: The state of this BFD session.

attribute.name: remoteDiscriminator
attribute.description: Specifies the remote discriminator defined by the remote endpoint for this BFD session.

attribute.name: diagCode
attribute.description: Specifies the reason for the latest transition of sessionState from UP to another state.

attribute.name: addrSrc
attribute.description: Specifies the local IP address of the BFD session.

class.name: BfdProfile
class.description: Represents a BFD Session Profile. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - Cannot remove an object referenced by other object(s): The MO cannot be deleted since it is referenced by other MO(s), whose DN(s) are listed in reservedBy attribute.

attribute.name: bfdProfileId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: detectionMultiplier
attribute.description: Specifies the desired detection time multiplier. The negotiated control packet transmission interval, multiplied by the multiplier, defines the detection time for this session, as seen by the remote system.

attribute.name: intervalTxMinDesired
attribute.description: Specifies the desired minimum transmission interval. It is the preferred minimum interval that the local system uses when transmitting BFD control packets.

attribute.name: intervalRxMinRequired
attribute.description: Specifies the minimum required reception interval. It is the minimum interval between received BFD control packets that the local system is capable of supporting.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

class.name: AddressIPv4
class.description: Represents an assigned IPv4 address including information about the subnet it resides on. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - System-protected object cannot be modified or deleted: The MO is system-protected and cannot be modified or deleted. - Invalid IPv4 address: Specified value for address attribute is not a valid IPv4 address. - Specified address conflicts with another address on the same Router: The subnet specified in address attribute includes or is included in another subnet configured on a different interface of the same Router.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: Specifies the IPv4 decimal address + "/" + prefix length <0-31>.

attribute.name: addressIPv4Id
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

class.name: InterfaceIPv4
class.description: Represents an IPv4-addressed termination point. It is an interface on an IPv4 routing domain. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - System-protected object cannot be modified or deleted: The MO is system-protected and cannot be modified or deleted. - Cannot define multiple loopback interfaces on same Router: A loopback interface already exists for this Router. - One of the attributes encapsulation and loopback must be set, but not both at the same time: Both encapsulation and loopback attributes are set or both are empty. - Invalid encapsulation specified: Specified encapsulation does not match any existing VLAN on the High Speed (HS) switch connected to the Router this interface belongs to. - Specified encapsulation VLAN does not have a valid VLAN ID: The VLAN selected as encapsulation does not have a VLAN ID configured. - Specified encapsulation VLAN is already used: Another Router's interface with the same encapsulation VLAN already exists.

attribute.name: interfaceIPv4Id
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: adminState
attribute.description: Specifies the administrative state of L3 interface. When LOCKED, the connection to the L3 stack is disabled and no L3 packets are received or transmitted or routed through.

attribute.name: bfdProfile
attribute.description: Specifies a reference to the BFD profile used for BFD sessions from this IP interface.
attribute.dependencies: When bfdStaticRoutes is ENABLED, bfdProfile must refer to a valid BfdProfile MO.

attribute.name: encapsulation
attribute.description: Specifies the reference to the underlying VLAN encapsulation.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Specifies the operational state of the IPv4 interface.

attribute.name: aclIngress
attribute.description: Specifies a reference to an ACL MO applied in the ingress direction. If this attribute is empty, no ACL MO filtering will take place in the ingress direction.
attribute.dependencies: If this attribute is set, loopback cannot be set.The referenced AclIpv4 MO must have at least one AclEntryIpv4 as a child. Only AclIpv4 MOs within the same router are allowed in an ACL association.

attribute.name: mtu
attribute.description: Specifies the MTU for IPv4.

attribute.name: bfdStaticRoutes
attribute.description: Specifies the intended state of BFD monitoring of static routing nexthops on this interface. To enable BFD monitoring, bfdStaticRoutes must be ENABLED, and bfdProfile must be defined. When BFD monitoring is enabled, all static routing nexthops on subnets of this IP interface will be monitored, unless explicitly disabled on peer/nexthop.

attribute.name: loopback
attribute.description: Specifies if the interface is an IP Loopback Interface.
attribute.dependencies: One of the attributes encapsulation and loopback must be set, but not both at the same time. Loopback cannot be set, if an ACL association exists, that is if aclEgress or aclIngress are set.The attribute egressQosMarking cannot be configured on an IP Loopback interface.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

class.name: RouteTableIPv4Static
class.description: Represents an IPv4 static route table information.

attribute.name: routeTableIPv4StaticId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: Dst
class.description: Represents an IPv4 destination network Information. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - Specified dst is already used: Another Dst with the same dst subnet already exists. - Invalid IPv4 subnet: Specified value for dst attribute is not a valid IPv4 subnet.

attribute.name: dstId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: dst
attribute.description: Specifies the IPv4 destination prefix for the route.

class.name: NextHop
class.description: Represents an IPv4 route Information. It contains next hop information on how to reach a destination network. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - One of the attributes address and discard must be set, but not both at the same time: Both address and discard attributes are set or both are empty. - Specified address conflicts with own address: Specified address coincides with an address configured on an InterfaceIPv4 on this Router.

attribute.name: nextHopId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: adminDistance
attribute.description: Specifies the distance of next hop. It is used to select the best path when there are two or more routes to the same destination from two different routing protocols.

attribute.name: bfdMonitoring
attribute.description: Specifies whether the availability of this route depends on a BFD session that monitors the nexthop. By setting this attribute to true, the availability of this route depends on the session state if a BFD session monitors the nexthop. By setting this attribute to false the availability of this route does not depend on the session state, even when a BFD session monitors the nexthop.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: Specifies the IP address of the nexthop gateway of this route. One of the attributes address and discard must be set, but only one of them.
attribute.dependencies: The address must not coincide with an address configured on an InterfaceIPv4 on this router.

attribute.name: discard
attribute.description: Specifies that packets with a destination that match this route are discarded. One of the attributes address and discard must be set, but only one of them at the same time.

class.name: Vrrpv3Session
class.description: Represents a VR session on one router. Normally these MOs exist in pairs, one for each InterfaceIpv4 MO with the same VLAN on each router in the node. An instance of the Vrrpv3Session MO can be created only if instances of the AddressIpV4 MO are created on both the referenced Vrrpv3Interface MO and the parent InterfaceIpv4 MO. Several Vrrpv3Session MOs that are children of the same InterfaceIpv4 are not allowed to reserve the same Vrrpv3Interface MO. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - Prioritized VRRP session already defined: Another VRRP session referencing the same VRRP interface is already configured as prioritized session. - VRRP session in owner mode must be prioritized: Referenced VRRP address matches an address configured on an InterfaceIPv4 of this Router hence this VRRP session is in owner mode and prioritizedSession must be set to true.

attribute.name: vrrpv3SessionId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: Specifies the administrative state of the VRRP session. Protocol operations are disabled when it is LOCKED.

attribute.name: prioritizedSession
attribute.description: Specifies the default role for this VRRP router. The value true defines the master role, and the value false defines the backup role. One of the two Vrrpv3Session MOs referring to the same Vrrpv3Interface MO must be configured as true, and the other must be configured as false. When the IP addresses in the two AddressIpv4 MOs specified below under a) and b) are equal, the session is in owner mode when it is in the master role. In this case, the attribute proiritizedSession must be configured as true. a) AddressIpv4 MO that is a child of the InterfaceIpv4 MO, of which this MO is a child. b) AddressIpv4 MO that is a child of the Vrrpv3Interface that this MO references.

attribute.name: vrrpState
attribute.description: Specifies the state of the virtual router.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifes a label for free usage.

attribute.name: vrrpv3InterfaceRef
attribute.description: Specifies the reference to the Vrrpv3Interface MO. Referenced MO contains common parameters for two Vrrpv3Sessions that are backup for each other. If prioritizedSession is set to false, the addresses of the two AddressIpv4 MOs specified below under a) and b) must not be equal: a) AddressIpv4 MO that is a child of the InterfaceIpv4 MO that this MO is a child of. b) AddressIpv4 MO that is a child of the Vrrpv3Interface that this MO is referencing.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: Specifies the master election priority. The value is 255 for a VRRP router in owner mode.

class.name: Vrrpv3Interface
class.description: Represents the unique VRRP router provided for a pair of VRRP sessions on two routers. It contains the attributes common for both VRRP sessions. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - Cannot remove an object referenced by other object(s): The MO cannot be deleted since it is referenced by other MO(s), whose DN(s) are listed in reservedBy attribute. - Specified VR ID is already used: Another VRRP Interface with the same VR ID already exists.

attribute.name: vrrpv3InterfaceId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: vrIdentity
attribute.description: Specifies the VRRP router identifier. The vrIdentity must be unique among all Vrrpv3Interface MO instances.

attribute.name: advertiseInterval
attribute.description: Specifies the time between sending the VRRP advertisement messages. Real VRRP convergence time = advertiseInterval * (4-(priority/256)). Priority is defined in the Vrrp3Session MO that becomes the new master.

attribute.name: preemptMode
attribute.description: Specifies the preemptive mode. When true, a higher-priority VRRP router can preempt a lower-priority master VRRP router. By default, preemption is enabled with no hold time. Preemption is enabled for a VRRP router in owner mode.

attribute.name: preemptHoldTime
attribute.description: Specifies the master preemption hold time. It is the time for which a higher-priority VRRP backup router must wait before preempting a lower-priority VRRP master. Configure the preemption hold time when the higher-priority server must wait before trying to preempt the current master. The preemption hold time is zero for a VRRP router in owner mode.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifes a label for free usage.

class.name: AclIpv4
class.description: Represents an ACL. It contains an ordered list of ACL entries. See the attribute priority for details on ordering. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied.

attribute.name: aclIpv4Id
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

class.name: AclEntryIpv4
class.description: Represents an entry in an ACL. It contains a set of filters for the ACL entry as well as an action and a priority. All filters refer to fields in the IP protocol header. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied.

attribute.name: aclEntryIpv4Id
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: Specifies the action of the ACL entry. When a packet matches the filters in this entry, the action is executed.

attribute.name: addrDst
attribute.description: Specifies the destination IP Address filter. The value is a list of IPv4 subnets: Value/prefix-length. The ACL entry matches if any address in the list matches. If the value list is empty, any IP address matches this entry.

attribute.name: addrSrc
attribute.description: Specifies the source IP Address filter. The value is a list of IPv4 subnets: Value/prefix-length. The ACL entry matches if any address in the list matches. If the value list is empty, any IP address matches this entry.

attribute.name: dscp
attribute.description: Specifies the DSCP field filter. The value is a list of DSCP values: Ranges [dd..dd] or single-values [dd], where dd represents an integer in {0..63}. The ACL entry matches if any DSCP value in the list matches. If the value list is empty, any DSCP value will match this entry.

attribute.name: fragmentType
attribute.description: Specifies the fragment type filter. The value is a fragment type. If the value is empty, state-less handling of fragments is performed.

attribute.name: icmpType
attribute.description: Specifies the ICMP type filter. The ACL entry matches if any element in the list matches. If the value list is empty, any ICMP types match this entry. It can be non-empty only if ipProtocol contains one single-value element, equal to ICMP (1).

attribute.name: ipProtocol
attribute.description: Specifies the protocol number filter. The value is a list of ranges [ddd..ddd] or single-values [ddd], where ddd represents an integer in the range {0..255}. The ACL entry matches if any protocol number in the list matches. If the value list is empty, any protocol number matches this entry.

attribute.name: portDst
attribute.description: Specifies the transport layer destination port filter (UDP, TCP or SCTP only). The value is a list of port numbers: Ranges [ddddd..ddddd] or single values [ddddd], where ddddd represents an integer in the range {0..65535}. This attribute can be non-empty only if the protocol is non-empty and if it contains elements that are single values equal to UDP (17), TCP (6), or SCTP (132). The ACL entry matches if any port number in the list matches. If the value list is empty, any port number matches this entry.

attribute.name: portSrc
attribute.description: Specifies the transport layer source port filter (UDP, TCP or SCTP only). The value is a list of port numbers: Ranges [ddddd..ddddd] or single values [ddddd], where ddddd represents an integer in the range {0..65535}. This attribute can be non-empty only if the protocol is non-empty and if it contains elements that are single values equal to UDP (17), TCP (6), or SCTP (132) The ACL entry matches if any port number in the list matches. If the value list is empty, any port number matches this entry.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: Specifies the priority of this ACL entry relative to the other entries in the list. The attribute values of the AclEntryIpv4 instances must be unique within the same AclIpv4 MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: A label for free usage.

class.name: ManagedObject
class.description: The ManagedObject MO represents a generic MO type. It does not represent any real resource in the system and can therefore not be instanciated. It is used as a MO-reference that can refer to multiple MO types.
